title: Junior Account Manager - Receivables Job at Julius Berger Nigeria Plc
content:
Julius Berger Nigeria Plc (Julius Berger) is a leading construction company offering integrated solutions and related services. Julius Berger specializes in executing complex works that require the highest level of technical expertise and Nigeria-specific know how.

We appreciate your interest in our company. Our success largely depends on the passion, precision and competence of our employees from. Become part of our team and help us in the realization of innovative and pioneering engineering projects. Experienced professionals and young professionals, we offer opportunities in technical and commercial fields. Take the chance and apply online with us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Junior Account Manager - Receivables
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full Time

What duties will you have?


	Manage accounts receivable and record customer invoices, incoming payments, credit notes and other relevant transactions.
	Regular checking and reconciliation of outstanding receivables.
	Proactive processing of open items, discrepancies and payment delays.
	Creating evaluations of receivables balances and other relevant financial reports.
	Working closely with commercial departments and management for accurate reporting of accounts receivable data.
	Participation in quarterly and year-end closing activities.


Job Requirements
What skills must you have?:


	A degree with a focus on business administration.
	At least two years of professional experience as an accounts receivable accountant (m/f/d).
	Confident in the use of Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel, as well as in the use of ERP systems (e.g. SAP FI/CO)
	Very good written and spoken English.
	You are characterized by a precise and structured way of working and a strong understanding of numbers.
	You demonstrate strong communication skills at all hierarchical levels and the independent motivation for further training.


What do we offer you?


	Responsible job with very good remuneration, various allowances, social benefits, low tax burden and good training opportunities.
	Comprehensive travel package including G35 examinations, vaccinations, visa and flight.
	Furnished, air-conditioned accommodation in the company's own camp with sports and leisure facilities, clubhouse and international TV programs.
	Family reunification of the spouse is possible, depending on the assignment location.
	Provision of transportation between accommodation and place of work
	A comprehensive security concept in Nigeria by external partners

title: HR Operations Officer Job at Estrada International Staffing Solutions
content:
Estrada International Staffing Solutions  - Our client, a top-tier player in Nigeria’s agribusiness space, with a significant market presence across the Southeast, is seeking results-driven candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Operations Officer

Job Location: Igbariam, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Lead end-to-end HR operations: recruitment, onboarding, staff records, and documentation.
	Handle employee relations, conflict resolution, and engagement activities.
	Provide regular reports on HR metrics, workforce analysis, and strategic inputs.
	Interface with local institutions, unions, and regulatory bodies when needed.
	Ensure compliance with HR policies, Nigerian labour laws, and internal regulations.
	Supervise attendance, leave, payroll coordination, and performance management.
	Support workforce planning and execution of HR strategies.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND in HR Management, Business Administration or a related field.
	4 - 7 years of experience in HR operations (FMCG, agriculture or manufacturing preferred).HR professional (CIPM or equivalent) is a strong added advantage.
	Strong working knowledge of Nigerian labour law and HR systems.
	Excellent people skills, documentation accuracy, and ethical judgement.
	Male candidate from or residing in Anambra State is preferred.


Benefits


	Salary: N400,000 - N600,000 Monthly. 
	Free staff bus transportation to and from site
	Company-provided accommodation (for the first 6 months)
	Health Insurance (HMO)
	Daily lunch meal provided
	Pension scheme
	13th-month salary
	Leave allowance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: a.okpaire@estradaintl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Cashier Job at Startup Soar
content:
Startup Soar (Recruitment Services) - Our client is a rapidly expanding restaurant located in the heart of Lokoja, known for its warm hospitality, exceptional food, and a dynamic customer-focused culture. As the brand continues to grow, it remains committed to delivering a seamless and pleasant dining experience for every guest.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Lokogoma, Lokoja - Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Hospitality

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Cashier to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing customer payments, handling cash and electronic transactions, and providing excellent customer service.
	This role is key to ensuring smooth financial operations and a positive customer experience at the point of sale.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet customers and provide friendly and efficient service during payment transactions.
	Accurately handle cash, credit card, and other payment methods.
	Issue receipts, refunds, or change due to customers.
	Coordinate with the kitchen and service team to address any billing or order issues.
	Keep the cashier area clean and organized.
	Balance cash drawer at the beginning and end of shifts.
	Maintain accurate records of transactions and prepare reports as required.
	Address customer inquiries or direct them to the appropriate personnel.
	Follow all company policies and procedures related to cash handling and security.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc or HND in Finance, Accounting, Banking, or another related field is preferred.
	3–4 years of experience as a cashier or in a similar role, preferably in hospitality or retail.
	Strong numerical skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to handle transactions accurately and responsibly.
	Basic computer proficiency and familiarity with POS systems.
	Honest, trustworthy, and reliable with a strong sense of integrity.
	Ability to work flexible shifts, including weekends and holidays.
	A team player with a positive attitude and good problem-solving skills.


Compensation and Benefits


	Competitive salary based on experience and performance
	Free accommodation for 3–4 months upon resumption
	Free meals will be provided to staff
	Career growth opportunities within a fast-growing brand
	Supportive, inclusive, and customer-focused work environment
	On-the-job training and development programs


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief Cover Letter to to: startupsoarhr@gmail.com using "Application for Cashier Position" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Senior Network Engineer Job at Ascentech Services Limited
content:
Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Network Engineer

Job Location: Surelere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: IT Infrastructure Manager / Network Manager
Department: IT / Network Operations

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Network Engineer with 5 - 7 years of experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining complex network infrastructures.
	The ideal candidate will have extensive hands-on experience with Sophos firewalls, along with a strong background in network security, LAN/WAN technologies, and troubleshooting.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, implement, and maintain enterprise network infrastructure to ensure high availability and security.
	Administer and manage Sophos firewalls, including rule creation, VPN setup, firmware upgrades, logging, and reporting.
	Configure and troubleshoot routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless access points.
	Monitor network performance and proactively identify and resolve issues.
	Maintain network documentation including diagrams, configurations, and SOPs.
	Ensure compliance with IT security policies and procedures.
	Perform regular network risk assessments and apply mitigation strategies.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams on new implementations and integrations.
	Provide Level 2/3 technical support for network-related incidents and service requests.
	Plan and execute network upgrades, patches, and backups.


Key Requirements


	5 to 7 years of experience in network engineering or IT infrastructure roles.
	Proven expertise with Sophos firewall technologies (XG, XGS series).
	Strong understanding of TCP/IP, VLANs, VPNs, NAT, routing protocols (BGP, OSPF), and wireless networking.
	Experience with network monitoring and analysis tools (e.g., Wireshark, PRTG, SolarWinds).
	Working knowledge of security best practices, firewall policies, and access controls.
	Familiarity with cloud networking (AWS, Azure) is a plus.
	Experience with other firewall solutions (e.g., Fortinet, Palo Alto) is a bonus.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Backend Software Developer Job at Ouranos Technologies (Ouranos)
content:
Ouranos Technologies (Ouranos) has established itself as a force to be reckoned with in delivering IT infrastructure services and solutions to clients in West Africa and beyond. At Ouranos, we design, build and provide solutions for business applications and core infrastructure including systems and storage, datacenters and enterprise, wide communication and networking.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Our in-depth industry knowledge, technical expertise and flexible delivery models help customers harness the best out of their IT investments by creating a reliable and scalable infrastructure. Our systems integration services have a comprehensive portfolio of implementation, support and consulting services solutions with exceptional people supporting business technology in action - talented professionals who bring technical insight, process excellence and resource flexibility to help customers in various verticals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Backend Software Developer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Job Summary


	We are seeking a Back-End Developer to join our team and work on the modernization of our legacy Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) system, which has been running for over 15 years in an on premise data center.
	This monolithic system, built on WebSphere Application Server, uses Hibernate and Oracle databases and is now undergoing a major transformation, including a migration to Azure Zulu JDK 17 and an upgrade to IBM Liberty.
	As we move forward with exposing remitter APIs, you will play a key role in the development, optimization, and migration of back-end services, ensuring system stability while integrating modern cloud-ready architectures.


Required Skills and Experience


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications
	Back-End Development: 10+ years of experience in Java Enterprise Edition (JEE).
	Java 8+ & OpenJDK: Experience migrating and maintaining Java applications.
	WebSphere & IBM Liberty: Hands-on experience with WebSphere Application Server and knowledge of IBM Liberty.
	Performance Optimization: Ability to fine-tune queries and optimize back-end processes.
	CI/CD & Deployment Pipelines: Familiarity with Git, Jenkins, or Azure DevOps for back-end automation.
	Hibernate & ORM: Strong understanding of Hibernate and database interaction with Oracle databases.
	API Development: Experience with RESTful APIs and integrating internal/external systems.
	Cloud Exposure: Some knowledge of Azure Cloud services is a plus.
	Banking/Financial Sector Experience: Understanding of security and compliance regulations.


Preferred Qualification:


	Experience with Spring Boot (even though it's not currently in use).
	Knowledge of microservices architecture for future transformation planning.
	Familiarity with containerization tools like Docker or Kubernetes.
	Exposure to message brokers (Kafka, RabbitMQ).
